title: Non-aural set, violin Mazurka - violin and piano

content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the relationship between the violin and the piano in measures 13â€“16 ?

choices.label: The violin imitates the piano melody.
The piano doubles the violin melody.
The violin has the main melody and the piano has a countermelody.
The piano has the main melody and the violin has a countermelody.

content.answer: The piano has the main melody and the violin has a countermelody.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.G: Use terms and symbols to describe aspects of musical design in notated music, including texture, timbre, and instrumentation, and expressive elements, including dynamics, articulation, and tempo.
